(2015) Falls - Omaha



Review:
Australian male-female duo (Simon Rudston-Brown and Melinda Kirwin) Falls offer catchy, introspective indie folk with warm vocal harmonies on their full- length debut, Omaha. Recorded in Omaha, Nebraska after the pair relocated to the U.S., it was produced by Mike Mogis, whoâ€™s also produced for the likes of Jenny Lewis, First Aid Kit, Bright Eyes, and M. Ward.
With Kirwin and Rudston-Brown sharing songwriting duties and trading lead vocals, the album features string arrangements from Tony Buchen â€” the producer behind the bandâ€™s first EP, Hollywood,
Amid folkier entries, the upbeat â€œSummerâ€ plays like â€™60s AM pop, â€œBetter Way to Goâ€ issues alt-country, and the lead single, â€œLet the Light In,â€ features Kirwinâ€™s melancholy vocals with atmospheric strings and gentle reverberation for a swirling ballad.
Rating 8/10
